intro: Sisymbrium columnae var. tenuisiliquum, commonly known as slender-stemmed ermannia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The species is characterized by its slender stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate and linear, often with a slightly hairy texture. This variety is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
